episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky historical and cultural facts, including a peculiar rumor about author George Eliot, the unusual use of ox testicles in grandfather clocks, the origin of the term 'motel', and a unique punishment involving the movie Bambi.

facts.fact: After the author George Elliott died, her family spent 50 years publicly denying that she had a massive right hand.
Some grandfather clocks used to use ox testicles for their pulleys.
The first motel was meant to be called a motor hotel, but the sign was too small to fit all the letters on.
A man found guilty of deer poaching has been sentenced to a year in prison and been ordered to watch Bambi once a month during that year.
